data.text: O God of the fathers, and Gr. Lord of thy mercy. Compare 2 Sam. vii. 15; Ps. lxxxix. 49.  Lord who keepest thy mercy,
And by thy wisdom thou formedst man,
And rule the world in holiness and righteousness,
Give me wisdom, her that sitteth by thee on thy Gr. thrones.  throne;
Because I am thy bondman and the son of thy handmaid,
For even if a man be perfect among the sons of men,
Thou didst choose me before my brethren  to be king of thy people,
Thou gavest command to build a sanctuary in thy holy mountain,
And with thee is wisdom, which knoweth thy works,
Send her forth out of the holy heavens,
For she knoweth all things and hath understanding thereof,
And so  shall my works be acceptible,
For what man shall know the counsel of God?
For the thoughts of mortals are The Greek text here is perhaps corrupt.  timorous,
For a corruptible body weigheth down the soul,
And hardly do we Gr. conjecture.  divine the things that are on earth,
And who ever  gained knowledge of thy counsel, except thou Or, hadst given...and sent  gavest wisdom,
And it was thus that the ways of them which are on earth were corrected,
